title: Sion is the most satisfying champion I have ever played. Partially due to his Voice/Sounds.
body:
And possibly the most fun too since pre-nerf zac. 

Sions ultimate alone just feels so god damn awesome to use. 

Whoever voiced Sion, give 'em a raise.

replies.body: As someone who plays a lot of immobile mages, I find Sion's ultimate to be one of the most terrifying abilities in the game.

Unless you're playing Anivia >:3

I blocked my fair share of Sion ults today!~
Haha yeah, I main Anivia so it's not too bad for her.  But Malzahar, well...
I bet the people over in Sound and Music would love to hear that! He does sound so badass though {{champion:14}}
New sion sounds and looks amazing, however his skills need work, the Q in particular is clunky.

I actually think his skills are fine. His Q feels pretty good, it's not a skill you use and spam at any given moment. You can use it to cut off someones retreat and force flashes, or use in tandem with your allies CC.
I miss the old "GET ON MY CHOPPER" line... so sad they didnt keep it in there along the lines of a joke emote or something...
The new VA for Sion is Scott McNeill. He also voices Hecarim and Maokai in League and in a *LOT* of other things.
Yep. I saw his voice on it and was amazed it was him. No wonder it took so long on the PBE, must've been all the screaming lines taking a toll on his voice.

kids these days

probably never saw arnold's movies growing up =_=

the voice changes were the biggest nerfs
I was just about to create a thread saying the exact opposite of this. Sion's new voice is the worst one since Nasus in terms of replacing awesome voices.
No way, he sounds fucking awesome! But then again, that is just my opinion. What champion do you most like the voice of?

I have to agree with you here. To me it sounds ridiculously forced, like a 15 yr old trying to sound like they have a deep voice. It just comes out sounding nasally and over the top dramatic. If it weren't so nasally it would actually sound scary.

I'm honestly really disappointed in this Sion update. He's so entirely item dependent now, needs ridiculous amounts of armor for survivability, and if you build HP your passive lasts an even shorter amount of time (hp loss is by %) because your life-steal is not enough. He's like a Tryndamere without the benefit of actually being able to survive. Their goal was to supposedly reinforce the ad style of play, but IMO they reinforced his old AP style of playing. He's got a short burst of damage, and can go train-mode into an enemy. His Q takes so long to charge that it's borderline worthless.
you sound like someone who never played the old sion
I loved the old Sion, but the new sion is just so much more comfortable. I do miss the arnie voice like everyone else who played him, but the gameplay is just more interesting with the new one.
